assessment_steps.extracted_paper_info: The paper clearly defines the disease mechanism relevant to the functional assay being described for this variant.

assessment_steps.step_name: Step 2: Evaluate applicability of general classes of assay used in the field
assessment_steps.extracted_paper_info: The general class of assay used effectively models or reflects the disease pathogenesis/mechanism defined in Step 1.

assessment_steps.step_name: Step 3: Evaluate validity of specific instances of assays
assessment_steps.extracted_paper_info: Basic controls and replicates were sufficient (Sub-step 3c). Known pathogenic variants used as controls for this variant.

assessment_steps.step_name: Step 4: Apply evidence to individual variant interpretation
assessment_steps.extracted_paper_info: Statistical analyses in the paper are sufficient to estimate or calculate OddsPath for the functional data for this variant (Sub-step 4a). For PS3 (Pathogenic), oddsPath is very high (>18.7) (Sub-step 4c).

overall_conclusion: The variant L858R in the EGFR gene is classified as pathogenic due to its high OddsPath value (>18.7).
